summary: This bill, the "Restoring Fair Housing Protections Eliminated by Trump Act of 2025," aims to reinstate and strengthen fair housing protections under the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD). It addresses actions taken by the previous administration that weakened these protections. Key provisions include: redefining "affirmatively furthering fair housing," requiring a review of complaints involving digital platforms and AI, and mandating a publicly available database of fair housing complaints. The bill seeks to combat housing discrimination and promote inclusive communities.
